com.launchdarkly.sdk.server.integrations

Class ConsulDataStoreBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.launchdarkly.sdk.server.integrations.ConsulDataStoreBuilder
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.launchdarkly.sdk.server.subsystems.ComponentConfigurer<com.launchdarkly.sdk.server.subsystems.PersistentDataStore>, com.launchdarkly.sdk.server.subsystems.DiagnosticDescription

    public final class ConsulDataStoreBuilder
extends java.lang.Object
implements com.launchdarkly.sdk.server.subsystems.ComponentConfigurer<com.launchdarkly.sdk.server.subsystems.PersistentDataStore>, com.launchdarkly.sdk.server.subsystems.DiagnosticDescription
    A builder for configuring the Consul-based persistent data store.

    Obtain an instance of this class by calling Consul.dataStore(). After calling its methods to specify any desired custom settings, wrap it in a PersistentDataStoreBuilder by calling Components.persistentDataStore(), then pass the result into the SDK configuration with LDConfig.Builder.dataStore(com.launchdarkly.sdk.server.subsystems.ComponentConfigurer). You do not need to call build(ClientContext) yourself to build the actual data store; that will be done by the SDK.

    The Consul client has many configuration options. This class has corresponding methods for some of the most commonly used ones. If you need more sophisticated control over the Consul client, you can construct one of your own and pass it in with the existingClient(Consul) method.

    Builder calls can be chained, for example: 

    
     LDConfig config = new LDConfig.Builder()
         .dataStore(
             Components.persistentDataStore(
                 Consul.dataStore()
                     .host("my-consul-host")
                     .prefix("app1")
             ).cacheSeconds(15)
         )
         .build();
    Since:
    1.1.0

      • existingClient

        public ConsulDataStoreBuilder existingClient(com.orbitz.consul.Consul client)
        Specifies an existing Consul client instance for the feature store to use. If you do this, other Consul configuration options from this builder such as host(String) will be ignored.
        Parameters:
        client - a Consul client instance
        Returns:
        the builder

      • prefix

        public ConsulDataStoreBuilder prefix(java.lang.String prefix)
        Sets the namespace prefix for all keys stored in Consul. Use this if you are sharing the same database table between multiple clients that are for different LaunchDarkly environments, to avoid key collisions.
        Parameters:
        prefix - the namespace prefix
        Returns:
        the builder
